Time? You have jeopardised this most vital part of the Dominator's war mission. You will remain on this planet and die with it.
Navigator Rago, I have been
You are useless unless you obey the Navigator's orders. Now check that seed device.
Oh.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Toba goes over to an egg shaped object in a clear box.

Dialogue.Line: Well?
Seed device is almost at critical mass.
You are fortunate, Toba. Now, time is running short. You must complete the operation with maximum speed. Has there been a reply from Fleet Leader concerning the potential use of slave labour force?
I will check.
No, I will. Take these aliens and place them under guard. Complete the centre borehole and place rockets in all perimeter holes, understood?
Command accepted.
Recall all Quarks from this ridiculous search and conserve their power. We can afford no more delays.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A Quark wastes energy shooting at a running Jamie and Cully. They duck down a sharp incline.

Dialogue.Line: That was too close for comfort.
They're all around us.
Aye.
Wait a minute. They're leaving, I think. Look!
Hey, you're right. Come on, let's get back to the shelter while there's still a chance.
All right, Cully?
Yes.
I've unblocked that ventilator shaft. At least we can breathe now.
Oh, I haven't have so much running about for years. Still, it was worth it.
Aye, we certainly stirred them up, didn't we. Anyway, we'll lie low a wee while and then nip out and get another Quark.
Oh, you don't believe in half measures, do you.
Well, it's important to keep the enemy guessing. Oh, I wish we had some food though. I'm fair famished.
Hold on, I seem to remember
What?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cully goes to a cupboard.

Dialogue.Line: Yes, survival kit. It goes with the shelter. Food, medicines, all that sort of thing. Ah!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cully puts an oblong slab on the table.

Dialogue.Line: Well, what's that?
Try it. Basic nutriments. Vitamins, carbohydrates, proteins. You can live on it for years.
Oh, I hope I'll not need to do that. Here, did you unblock that periscope?
Yes.
Good. Let's see if we were followed.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie pulls down the periscope and looks around.

Dialogue.Line: Hey Cully, would you look who's here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: It's the Doctor, Teel and Kando.

Dialogue.Line: Any Quarks?
Yes, one.
Oh.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The periscope looks further to the left, where Toba is instructing a pair of Quarks at the drill head.

Dialogue.Line: No, there's more. Can't quite see but I think they're working at something just outside the building.
Let's have a look. Aye, they don't seem to have harmed anybody.
Well, Balan isn't there.
Aye, he's probably working somewhere else.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie pushes the periscope back into the roof.

Dialogue.Line: Look, Cully
What now?
We can't just let them stay up there, can we.
Well, what can we do?
Get them down here with us.
But what about the Quarks?
Well, we'll just
Here we go again. But how?
Aye well, I don't know yet. Ah, wait a minute.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie takes a sheet off a bunk.

Dialogue.Line: Yes.
Operate.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Two Quarks power the drill.
One Quark stands guard.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor?
Hmm?
What are they doing?
They're drilling.
Well, yes, I know that, but what for?
Hmm? Oh, I don't think they want to take anything out of the earth, Zoe, rather put something into it.
Well, what?
Well, if I'm right. Oh no!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie has come up from the shelter and is creeping up on the Quark. He has the sheet twisted up into a rope and is about to throw it round its 'neck' when the Quark moves forward. Jamie moves forward and instead ties it around the robot's 'ankles'. Then it stands on Jamie's hand. The Doctor gets up.

Dialogue.Line: Excuse me. I wonder
Do not move!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Quark moves towards the Doctor and Jamie pulls on the sheet rope, toppling it over onto it's side. Jamie sits on it as it makes beeping noises.

Dialogue.Line: Right, Cully.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cully puts another sheet over the Quark's head.

Dialogue.Line: Quick, follow me!
Doctor, go on!
Quick!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: When the others have run off, Jamie gets off the Quark.

Dialogue.Line: Cease drilling. A Quark is being attacked. Follow!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Everyone is safely in the bomb shelter as Toba and the Quarks enter.

Dialogue.Line: Quarks. Search and destroy.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Toba takes the sheet off the Quark and puts it on its feet. It stops beeping.

Dialogue.Line: Quark, where are the prisoners?
Sensor out of action. No recorded data.
They can't be far away. They must be hiding. Quarks, search and destroy!
Command countermanded! Why has the drilling stopped again, Toba?
The prisoners have attacked a Quark and escaped.

And once again you drop everything to hunt them. I have just completed calculating the remaining power levels of the Quark force. Thanks to your foolish actions they are dangerously low. All efforts must now be concentrated on completing our mission.
And if they attack us again?
The Quark's power must be conserved. Complete the drilling operation.
Command accepted.
Toba. The primitives will not go unpunished. Fleet leader has just confirmed the Dulcians are unsuitable for slave labour. They will die with their planet.
Good! So the sooner we complete the drilling operations the sooner they will die. Quarks, follow.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cully has been looking through the periscope.

Dialogue.Line: They're gone.
That was very rash of you, Jamie. Those Quarks are appallingly dangerous.
Och, they're not so terrible.
You know, we dropped a rock on one earlier.
Aye.
Hey, where's Balan? Why wasn't he
He's dead, Cully. The Dominators killed him.
Oh, no. If only we'd managed to get him away too.
You did your best. Cully.
It's thanks to you and Jamie that the rest of us are safe. DOCTOR: I'm afraid not. Nowhere on the island is safe. Nowhere on the entire planet, come to that.
You see we heard the Dominators say that the Dulcians were unsuitable for slave labour.
But then they'll leave us in peace?
Well, no. They said you'd all die with your planet.
Surely they don't mean to destroy Dulkis completely?
I'm afraid they do.
But why? What do they want?
A large amount of fuel for their invasion fleet.
But we know that there are no minerals worth having. At least not on this side of the island.
They're not mining for minerals, or any natural fuel source.
But their spaceships use atomic power. We've established that.
But there was no reactor in their ship of theirs, only a radiation storage unit. You remember how, when they landed, it sucked up all the radioactive dust from the island?
Yes. So you're saying that they store radioactive particles and then convert that energy into power.
Exactly.
But then why are they drilling?
Look, I'll show you. (The Doctor uses a piece of chalk to draw on the table.)

There are four drill holes, here, here, here and here. And one drill hole in the centre. Now then, they have rockets mounted in each of these drill holes, and the centre hole is probably for that atomic seed device.
Oh.
Well don't you see? They've chosen this spot because the crust of the planet is thin. They're going to fire the rockets through the crust into the magma, the molten core.
And that will almost certainly fracture the crust of the planet.
Exactly.
But that will create a volcano. And if they explode the atomic seed device in the middle of that
Yes, that's right, Zoe. The whole planet will become one vast molten mass of radioactive material. The fuel store for their fleet.
Well, we'll just have to stop them, then.
Oh Jamie, it's not as simple as that, is it? If only I could get hold of that atomic seed device, I might be able to defuse it.
Yes. Then there'd only be a local volcanic eruption on the island.
Yes.
How can we get to the device?
Yes, that's the problem.
Doctor, I've just had an idea.
Shush a minute Jamie, I'm trying to think.
Yes I know you are, but
Oh Jamie.
Will you listen to me. Now there's a dead easy way to get that device thing.
Really?
Yes, now listen. You said they were going to drop it down the centre hole, the one they're drilling outside here.
Yes.
Well it's simple isn't it? All we've got to do is dig a tunnel through from here to the borehole and catch the seed device thing on it's way down. Well, it was just an idea.
But Jamie, it's a brilliant idea! It's so simple only you could have thought of it.
Oh. Eh?
We can get the direction from the periscope. Just line it up with the drilling site.
Yes, there's only one snag though. Could we complete the tunnel in time? It'd have to be twelve feet long or more.
Well Cully and I could delay the Dominators' work up there.
How?
Oh, we're getting very good at destroying Quarks, aren't we?
Yes, certainly seems to stop them working.
Yes, that's true, but you've been lucky so far. If only I could devise some sort of weapon for you. Is anything down here, Cully?
I doubt it. Nothing but survival rations and medical kits.
Medical kit, oh. It's surprising what you can do with a few simple chemicals and a little ingenuity. Now come on, we must dig this tunnel. Zoe, give us a direction will you?
Right. Er, on a line from here.
Right! We start there tunnel there. Get that bunk away. Come on.
That's it, Cully. I'll start it off with a knife, now. This line here.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Jamie tries to dig through the concrete with his sgian dubh.

Dialogue.Line: I think you'd better let me start it, Jamie.
How are you going to dig through there with your sonic screwdriver?
It's a little more than a screwdriver. Just watch this.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor twiddles with his little device and it becomes an oxyacetylene torch, cutting easily through the wall.

Dialogue.Line: Where'd he get the technology to do that?
It's burning straight through.
Aye, the Doctor's very good.
Cease drilling.
Report progress.
Proceeding as planned. Operation will be completed on schedule.
Good. All rockets are now in position. No further sign of the aliens?
No.
Good. Continue. Inform me when you are ready for the seed device.
Command accepted.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Kando and Teel clear the entrance to their tunnel.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, we can't wait much longer.
What's the Doctor trying to do?
I've no idea. Look, Doctor, I don't think we should wait, you know.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor and Zoe are mixing chemicals.

Dialogue.Line: Hang on, Jamie. This is ready. Now if this works you should have a good chance of distracting the Quarks, and maybe even destroying one or two of them. Right, come on, Zoe, let's try it.
What, in here?
Yes, in here. There you are. Just a bit.
All right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Zoe pours some powder into a small vial.

Dialogue.Line: Whoa, whoa, that'll do. Now then, Jamie, all you've got to do is to add one of these little number nine pills to each bottle just before you throw it, like that.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor drops in a pill and seals the vial.

Dialogue.Line: But whatever you do, and this is important, you must throw it before ten seconds have elapsed, otherwise you're liable to blow up with
Seven, eight, Doctor!
What?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor tosses the vial away and everyone ducks as it goes bang!

Dialogue.Line: It works!
You could have blown us all to kingdom come!
No, no, Jamie, that was just a small quantity. But with ten times that amount you should have quite a handy little bomb.
Two each side.
Yes. Where do we start?
Well one of the Quark's as good as another. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: They go to a point on the cliff directly over the drill. Cully pops a pill into a vial and Jamie tosses it over the edge.

Dialogue.Line: Two, three, four, five

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Bang, and the middle Quark staggers then falls on its side, beeping.

Dialogue.Line: Not quite. Quick, another one!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The repeat performance gets all three as the other two go to aid their comrade. Just a few smoking bits remain.

Dialogue.Line: That's it! Quick, round the other side.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: In the saucer, the Quark lights flicker. Rago heads out.
The explosions can be heard.

Dialogue.Line: Cease drilling. Quarks, search and des. Wait. Continue working.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Zoe is at the periscope.

Dialogue.Line: They've started again.
Oh dear. It's obviously going to take quite a disturbance to stop them drilling. Teel? Teel, how far have you got?
A little bit further than my own length.
Teel, come out and take your rest. Zoe, your turn. Come on.
I hope Jamie and Cully are all right.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Not so distant bang.

Dialogue.Line: It sounds as though they're having great fun.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: A group of Quarks walking along a gully get treated to a couple of near misses. Meanwhile, Rago comes to the drilling point.

Dialogue.Line: Cease drilling.
Two more Quarks have been destroyed.
You should have let me destroy the aliens!
Silence! We have eight Quarks left, but their power levels are very low. Do your two Quarks have sufficient power to complete the drilling?
Quarks, check power levels and report. QUARK 1: Power level two units only. QUARK 2: Power level five units only.
Equalise.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The two Quarks hold hands.

Dialogue.Line: They will have enough for drilling.
Good. Continue operations.
They've started drilling again. Look, we've got to stop them somehow.
That's going to be tricky.
I know, but the others need more time. Come on.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Zoe has finished her stint in the tunnel.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, we must be merely six feet or so from the borehole, I can hear their drill.
Yes, but they must be nearly finished by now.
Right, I'll take another turn.
Is there any sign of Jamie and Cully?
No, they're still up there. Unfortunately they're taking

Dialogue.Stage Direction: BOOM and the shelter quakes.

Dialogue.Line: Oh, that was close.
Yes.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Zoe looks through the periscope to see the drill has fallen over and flattened one of the Quarks. Toba is trying to get up.

Dialogue.Line: I think they've attacked the drilling Quarks.
Has the drilling stopped?
I think. Yes!
Toba!
Ah, these primitives again! You see what damage they're doing with their primitive explosives? We must destroy them!
Replace the Quark. Continue operation. You will not be interrupted anymore. I will personally destroy these primitives. Quarks, follow.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cully and Jamie run along a gully, but there are two Quarks ahead.

Dialogue.Line: Back!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There are three more behind them.

Dialogue.Line: It's no good. We're trapped.
Up here. Quarks can't climb, I hope.
Quarks, destroy.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The shots miss Jamie and Cully.

Dialogue.Line: Recharge force units. Report failure.
Power levels low. Distance too great for accurate aim.
Finish order. Destroy.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: At the top of the slope, Cully is caught by a shot.

Dialogue.Line: Come on. Right, Cully, I think we're safe now.
Wait. It's my arm. I can't move it. Nor my leg. You'd better leave me behind.
Now don't be ridiculous. I'll give you help.
Those Quarks will be after us in no time.
Aye. How many of those bombs have you got left?
Quarks, form a flank movement round this area. Disperse.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor has been taking his turn at digging.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, they've started drilling again. The blast didn't destroy that Quark and Toba's managed to get the drill working again.
Yes, I know, I can hear it up there. We must be pretty near.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The hatch opens.

Dialogue.Line: Shush.
Doctor, help him. He's hurt.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cully comes down the ladder.

Dialogue.Line: What happened?
He was hit by a Quark. Lucky for him its power levels were low.

My word, lucky indeed! Come along, down you come. All right, Cully. Get over to the bunk. Get the table out of the way. Here. There we are. It's all right, Cully. Sit down. Mind your head. There we are, there. Now then.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Cully lies on the bunk.

Dialogue.Line: My arm seems to be paralysed.
Can you move your fingers? Ah, you're lucky. I think it's only temporary paralysis.
Oh, don't worry about me. Get on with the tunnel.
Thanks to you and Jamie, it's nearly finished.
Doctor, I think the Dominators have finished drilling too.
What? We've still got a few feet left!
Have you finished?
Yes, just completed.
Good! I shall enjoy destroying this planet and its creatures. Get the seed device. We will delay no longer.
Can you see the borehole yet, Jamie?
Och, the ceiling keeps caving in.
They're coming back! Toba's bringing the seed device.
Oh dear.
I'm through!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Toba hands over the seed device in its box.

Dialogue.Line: You will recall all Quarks from their positions and prepare the craft for take off.
Command accepted.
I will insert the seed device. Prime the rockets at perimeter boreholes.
Command accepted.
I will soon see this planet die and it's creatures with it.
Shall I report to Fleet Leader?
Inform him the Dominator fleet may approach in its refueling orbit.
Command accepted. Quarks, follow.
Quickly, Doctor. He's taking the device out of its case now. Oh, Jamie, he'll be too late. He's putting it in now.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: Rago drops the seed device down the hole.

Dialogue.Line: It's gone!
Argh!
Doctor, have you caught it?
Oh, Doctor.
He's coming.
Quick, out. Well?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor holds up the large egg.

Dialogue.Line: We're saved! We're saved.
Not just yet. I've still got to defuse it before they explode it. Oh. Oh, my word.
What?
Well, it's sealed. It's completely sealed! I can't possibly undo it!
You mean all that was for nothing? We're still going to get blown up?
Yes, I'm afraid so, unless I can think of some way of getting it off the planet without a
Have you thought of something?
Well, there is a way of getting it off the planet without it doing any harm to any of us at all.
Well how?
Ha! But it's not going to be easy.
What're you going to do?

Now just leave it to me, Jamie. You and Zoe go back to the Tardis. Teel, take Kando and Cully and get them to the capsule and go to the Capital. Tell them that there'll be a minor volcanic eruption, but with any luck nothing more violent.
But what're you going
There isn't time, Jamie! Come along!
Is all prepared?
Yes. Just two more Quarks to arrive.
Start take off procedure.
Command accepted.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor runs across the island and gets to the saucer just as the last Quark arrives. It enters the airlock and he places the seed device behind it just before the inner door closes. He barely gets back out through the outer doors.

Dialogue.Line: All Quarks now accounted for.
Power level?
Capacity for lift off.
Electromagnetic field, contact!
All systems functioning.
Proceed with lift off!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The saucer lifts off from the sandy island, retracting its legs almost immediately.

Dialogue.Line: Oh where is he?
The Dominator's ship. It's away!
Oh.
Where's the Doctor?

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The Doctor runs up behind them, out of breath.

Dialogue.Line: Doctor!
Hey, where's the bomb thing?
Oh, did you get rid of it?
Where is it?
Don't ask me any questions. There's no time.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: There's a bang and a whoosh.

Dialogue.Line: What's that?
It's the rockets in the other perimeter holes. Come along. We'd better get inside the Tardis. There's going to be an all

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The ground shakes.

Dialogue.Line: Toba! Stop the countdown.

Dialogue.Stage Direction: The seed device rolls out of the inner airlock and across the floor. Dominator jaws drop in horror.

Dialogue.Line: Impossible, countdown has started!
Obey!

Dialogue.Stage Direction: KaBOOM!

Dialogue.Line: Doctor, come on, will ye? The whole place is going to blow up.
Oh, it's quite all right, Jamie. The planet is quite safe. There's just going to be a localised volcanic eruption. It'll only affect the island.
Maybe so, but we happen to be on the island.
Oh, my word!
